summary: This is a civil complaint filed in the Southern District of New York by an anonymous plaintiff (referred to as 'Plaintiff' or 'Jane Doe No. 102') against Ghislaine Maxwell for defamation. The plaintiff alleges Maxwell made false and malicious public statements in January 2015 to discredit her, calling her a liar about her allegations of being recruited as a minor and sexually abused by Maxwell and Jeffrey Epstein. The complaint details the plaintiff's history as a victim, Maxwell's alleged role in the abuse, and the subsequent defamation campaign.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: The defendant in this defamation lawsuit. The plaintiff alleges Maxwell recruited her as a minor for Jeffrey Epstein, participated in her sexual abuse, and later conducted a malicious campaign to publicly discredit her by calling her a liar.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Described as the primary perpetrator who, with Maxwell's assistance, sexually abused the plaintiff and over 30 other minor girls. He entered a Non-Prosecution Agreement in 2007 and pled guilty to procuring a minor for prostitution.

persons.name: Ross Gow
persons.context: Acted as Maxwell's agent in January 2015, issuing false statements to the media accusing the plaintiff of lying, as part of Maxwell's alleged campaign to discredit her.

persons.name: David Boies
persons.context: Attorney from Boies Schiller & Flexner LLP who signed and filed this complaint on behalf of the plaintiff.

persons.name: Sigrid McCawley
persons.context: Attorney from Boies Schiller & Flexner LLP who signed the complaint on behalf of the plaintiff.

persons.name: Ellen Brockman
persons.context: Attorney from Boies Schiller & Flexner LLP who signed the complaint on behalf of the plaintiff.

persons.name: Jane Doe No. 1
persons.context: Another victim of Jeffrey Epstein who filed a petition in 2008 to enforce her rights under the Crime Victims' Rights Act, challenging Epstein's non-prosecution agreement. The plaintiff later moved to join this litigation.

connections.description: Alleged to have worked together in a sex trafficking scheme where Maxwell recruited underage girls for Epstein to sexually abuse. The complaint states Maxwell was a 'primary co-conspirator and participant'.
Gow is described as Maxwell's 'authorized agent' who made defamatory public statements on her behalf and with her direct authority as part of a campaign to discredit the plaintiff.
The plaintiff alleges Maxwell recruited her as a minor, facilitated her sexual abuse by Epstein, and later defamed her publicly to silence her.
The plaintiff alleges Epstein sexually abused her repeatedly between 1999 and 2002 with Maxwell's assistance.

events.title: Period of Plaintiff's Abuse
events.description: The plaintiff alleges she was sexually abused by Jeffrey Epstein at multiple locations, including his mansions in West Palm Beach, Florida, and New York, with the assistance of Ghislaine Maxwell.

events.title: Epstein's Non-Prosecution Agreement (NPA)
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein entered into a Non-Prosecution Agreement with the U.S. Attorney's Office, barring federal prosecution for sex crimes and granting immunity to potential co-conspirators, including Maxwell. The agreement included a confidentiality provision not disclosed to victims.

events.title: Jane Doe No. 1 Files CVRA Petition
events.description: Another victim, Jane Doe No. 1, filed a petition to enforce her rights under the Crime Victims' Rights Act, alleging the government failed to provide her rights regarding Epstein's plea arrangement. This litigation was ongoing at the time of this complaint.

events.title: Plaintiff Files Complaint as Jane Doe No. 102
events.description: The plaintiff, identified as Jane Doe No. 102, filed a complaint against Jeffrey Epstein in the Southern District of Florida, detailing Maxwell's role in recruiting and facilitating her abuse.

events.title: FBI Interview in Australia
events.description: Two FBI agents located the plaintiff in Australia, where she had been hiding, and interviewed her at the U.S. Consulate in Sydney. She provided information about the abuse by Epstein and Maxwell.

events.title: Founding of Victims Refuse Silence, Inc.
events.description: The plaintiff incorporated a Florida not-for-profit corporation called Victims Refuse Silence, Inc., dedicated to helping survivors of sexual abuse and human trafficking.

events.title: Maxwell's Defamation Campaign
events.description: Ghislaine Maxwell, personally and through her agent Ross Gow, undertook a concerted campaign to discredit the plaintiff, issuing false statements to the media calling the plaintiff's allegations 'untrue' and 'obvious lies'.

keyFacts: The plaintiff, an anonymous victim (Jane Doe No. 102), alleges Ghislaine Maxwell recruited her as a minor for Jeffrey Epstein and participated in her sexual abuse between 1999 and 2002.
The complaint alleges Maxwell was granted immunity from federal prosecution in the Southern District of Florida through the 2007 Non-Prosecution Agreement made with Jeffrey Epstein.

In January 2015, Maxwell, through her agent Ross Gow and personally, publicly called the plaintiff a liar, stating her allegations were 'untrue' and 'obvious lies', which forms the basis of this defamation lawsuit.

The plaintiff founded a non-profit, Victims Refuse Silence, Inc., in December 2014 to help survivors of sexual abuse and trafficking, and alleges Maxwell's defamation campaign aimed to destroy her credibility in this work.

The document reveals Maxwell previously avoided a deposition in related civil litigation by falsely claiming her mother was deathly ill and she was leaving the U.S. for London permanently, but returned to New York within weeks.
